definition: tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: In here, from the slash-and-burn cultivation to the high tech agriculture, obtains the demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏，從刀耕火種到高科技農業，都得到展示。

sentences.english: Don’t wait for spontaneous combustion or for someone to set light to you.
sentences.chinese: 不要等待自燃，或別人爲你提供火種。

sentences.english: And the seed of the fire gets feeble and cold.
sentences.chinese: 那燃燒的火種也漸漸微弱，冷卻了。

sentences.english: As with any movement, a spark is needed to start word spreading.
sentences.chinese: 像任何一場運動一樣，帶動消息傳播需要一個火種。

sentences.english: The Maya are thought by many to have used slash-and-burn agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 很多人認爲瑪雅人採取的是刀耕火種的農業種植方式。

sentences.english: What the hand dare seize the fire?
sentences.chinese: 敢用什麼手攫取這火種？

sentences.english: The kindling to happen along is exactly the inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 這意外出現的火種就是靈感。

sentences.english: My fire may be tiny, but it’s a fire just the same.
sentences.chinese: 我的火種可能很微弱，但再微弱它畢竟也是火。

sentences.english: Be deceived into and be deceived into being kindling since at heart but burning out the different flame.
sentences.chinese: 騙與被騙都是由於心中的火種而燃燒出不同的火焰。

sentences.english: In that love is the greatness of being.
sentences.chinese: 愛裏面是有孕育力，一顆純潔的火種。

sentences.english: Your sling is flammable. Do not use it near open flames or other heat sources.
sentences.chinese: 你的揹帶是易燃物品，使用時請遠離火種或其他火源。

sentences.english: Therefore, selenium is called "the kindling of life" and "bodyguard of health".
sentences.chinese: 因此，硒元素被稱爲“生命的火種，健康的衛士”。

sentences.english: This is known as slash and burn.
sentences.chinese: 這就是所謂的刀耕火種。

sentences.english: The sacred fire Ying-sky, ancient civilizations Kim added.
sentences.chinese: 神聖火種映蒼穹，文明古國再添金。

sentences.english: The AllSpark is destroyed and without it, our race will perish.
sentences.chinese: 火種被摧毀了，沒有它，我們的種族將會滅亡。

sentences.english: Only a concerted effort by both of us had kept the fire alive.
sentences.chinese: 只有我們雙方協調的努力才能讓火種常久不熄。

definition: to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to change (sth)/to alter (sth)/to change over (to sth else)
